skill.name: nx-monorepo
skill.description: Nx monorepo management skill for AI-native development. This skill should be used when working with Nx workspaces, project graphs, affected detection, code generation, and caching. Use when: analyzing dependencies, running affected commands, generating code, configuring Nx Cloud, or optimizing build performance. Invoke nx-mcp tools for documentation queries.
skill.summary: Nx monorepo management skill for AI-native development. This skill should be used when working with ...
skill.author: Asmayaseen

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond its own directory. MCP tools provide documentation lookup only.

content.value_statement: Nx monorepo management requires deep knowledge of project graphs, affected commands, and caching strategies. This skill provides expert guidance for analyzing dependencies, running targeted builds, and optimizing CI pipelines using Nx CLI and official MCP tools.
actual_capabilities: Analyze project dependencies with Nx graph visualization
Detect and run affected commands across the monorepo
Generate applications and libraries with Nx generators
Configure local and remote caching for faster builds
Set up Nx Cloud for distributed computation caching
Integrate Python apps using uv workspaces with Nx
limitations: Does not execute Nx commands directly - provides guidance for user execution
Requires Nx to be installed in the project
Does not modify project configuration files automatically
No built-in support for non-Nx monorepo tools

use_cases.title: Optimize CI/CD pipelines
use_cases.description: Configure affected-based builds to run only changed projects, reducing CI time from hours to minutes.

use_cases.title: Generate code consistently
use_cases.description: Use Nx generators to create applications and libraries with standardized patterns and shared configurations.

use_cases.title: Manage monorepo governance
use_cases.description: Set up CODEOWNERS, RFC processes, and cross-team coordination for large-scale monorepo projects.

best_practices: Run nx affected commands in CI to skip unchanged projects
Configure targetDefaults in nx.json to enable caching for all build-like tasks
Use feature flags to ship incomplete work without breaking the main branch
anti_patterns: Running full builds instead of affected-only builds in CI
Skipping CODEOWNERS file for large monorepos
Creating long-lived branches instead of trunk-based development

faq.question: Does this skill work with all Nx versions?
faq.answer: Yes, it supports Nx 17+ which includes the official MCP server integration.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with non-TypeScript projects?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill covers Python integration via uv workspaces and any language supported by Nx plugins.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my files?
faq.answer: No, this skill only provides guidance and documentation. Users must execute Nx commands themselves.

faq.question: Is my data sent to Nx Cloud?
faq.answer: Nx Cloud is optional. Remote caching requires explicit connection via npx nx connect command.

faq.question: What if my project uses a different monorepo tool?
faq.answer: This skill is Nx-specific. For Turborepo or other tools, use skills designed for those platforms.

faq.question: How is this different from nx-mcp alone?
faq.answer: This skill provides comprehensive documentation, workflow patterns, and best practices beyond basic MCP tool usage.
